query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Da poi che Carlo tuo, bella Clemenza, 2 m’ebbe chiarito, mi narrò li ’nganni 3 che ricever dovea la sua semenza;

Please translate each line literally into English.
4 ma disse: «Taci e lascia muover li anni»; 5 sì ch’io non posso dir se non che pianto 6 giusto verrà di retro ai vostri danni.

Please translate each line literally into English.
7 E già la vita di quel lume santo 8 rivolta s’era al Sol che la rïempie 9 come quel ben ch’a ogne cosa è tanto.
query.result: 7 And already the life of that holy light 8 had turned to the Sun that fills it, 9 like that good which is so much to every thing.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Ahi anime ingannate e fatture empie, 11 che da sì fatto ben torcete i cuori, 12 drizzando in vanità le vostre tempie!
query.result: 10 Ah, deluded souls and wicked creatures, 11 who turn your hearts from such good, 12 directing your temples in vain things!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Ed ecco un altro di quelli splendori 14 ver’ me si fece, e ’l suo voler piacermi 15 significava nel chiarir di fori.
query.result: 13 And behold, another of those splendors 14 approached me, and his wish to please me 15 was signified in his outward brightness.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Li occhi di Bëatrice, ch’eran fermi 17 sovra me, come pria, di caro assenso 18 al mio disio certificato fermi.
query.result: 16 Beatrice's eyes, which were fixed 17 on me, as before, with dear consent 18 to my desire, became still, assuring me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 «Deh, metti al mio voler tosto compenso, 20 beato spirto», dissi, «e fammi prova 21 ch’i’ possa in te refletter quel ch’io penso!».
query.result: 19 "Ah, quickly fulfill my wish, 20 blessed spirit," I said, "and give me proof 21 that I can reflect in you what I think!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Onde la luce che m’era ancor nova, 23 del suo profondo, ond’ ella pria cantava, 24 seguette come a cui di ben far giova:
query.result: 22 Whereupon the light that was still new to me, 23 from its depths, whence it had sung before, 24 continued, as one who delights in doing good:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 «In quella parte de la terra prava 26 italica che siede tra Rïalto 27 e le fontane di Brenta e di Piava,
query.result: 25 "In that part of the wicked land of Italy 26 that sits between Rialto 27 and the springs of the Brenta and the Piave,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 si leva un colle, e non surge molt’ alto, 29 là onde scese già una facella 30 che fece a la contrada un grande assalto.
query.result: 28 a hill rises, and it does not rise very high, 29 from which a torch once descended 30 that made a great assault on the region.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 D’una radice nacqui e io ed ella: 32 Cunizza fui chiamata, e qui refulgo 33 perché mi vinse il lume d’esta stella;
query.result:
31 I and she were born of one root: 32 I was called Cunizza, and I shine here 33 because the light of this star overcame me;
(Note: Cunizza da Romano was a 13th-century Italian noblewoman who was known for her beauty, intelligence, and political skills. She was the sister of Ezzelino III da Romano, a powerful and ruthless tyrant. Cunizza is mentioned in Dante's Paradiso as an example of someone who was able to overcome the temptations of the world and achieve spiritual enlightenment.)

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 ma lietamente a me medesma indulgo 35 la cagion di mia sorte, e non mi noia; 36 che parria forse forte al vostro vulgo.
query.result:
34 but I gladly indulge myself 35 in the cause of my fate, and it does not grieve me; 36 which perhaps would seem strange to your common people.
(Note: Cunizza is saying that she does not regret her past actions, even though they led to her being condemned to Hell. She is content with her fate because she knows that she has achieved spiritual enlightenment.)

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Di questa luculenta e cara gioia 38 del nostro cielo che più m’è propinqua, 39 grande fama rimase; e pria che moia,
query.result: 37 Of this resplendent and dear joy 38 of our heaven that is closest to me, 39 great fame remains; and before it dies,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 questo centesimo anno ancor s’incinqua: 41 vedi se far si dee l’omo eccellente, 42 sì ch’altra vita la prima relinqua.
query.result: 40 this hundredth year will still be added: 41 see if a person should make himself excellent, 42 so that the first life leaves behind another.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 E ciò non pensa la turba presente 44 che Tagliamento e Adice richiude, 45 né per esser battuta ancor si pente;

Please translate each line literally into English.
46 ma tosto fia che Padova al palude 47 cangerà l’acqua che Vincenza bagna, 48 per essere al dover le genti crude;

Please translate each line literally into English.
49 e dove Sile e Cagnan s’accompagna, 50 tal signoreggia e va con la testa alta, 51 che già per lui carpir si fa la ragna.
query.result: 49 and where the Sile and Cagnano meet, 50 such a one lords it over and goes with his head held high, 51 that already the birdlime is being made to ensnare him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Piangerà Feltro ancora la difalta 53 de l’empio suo pastor, che sarà sconcia 54 sì, che per simil non s’entrò in malta.
query.result: 52 Feltro will also weep for the default 53 of its wicked shepherd, which will be so shameful, 54 that no one has ever entered a ditch for the like.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Troppo sarebbe larga la bigoncia 56 che ricevesse il sangue ferrarese, 57 e stanco chi ’l pesasse a oncia a oncia,
query.result: 55 The vat that would receive the blood of Ferrara 56 would be too large, 57 and he who weighed it ounce by ounce would be tired,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 che donerà questo prete cortese 59 per mostrarsi di parte; e cotai doni 60 conformi fieno al viver del paese.
query.result: 58 which this courteous priest will give away 59 to show himself to be of a party; and such gifts 60 will be in keeping with the life of the land.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Sù sono specchi, voi dicete Troni, 62 onde refulge a noi Dio giudicante; 63 sì che questi parlar ne paion buoni».

Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Qui si tacette; e fecemi sembiante 65 che fosse ad altro volta, per la rota 66 in che si mise com’ era davante.
query.result: 64 Here he fell silent; and he made it seem to me 65 that he had turned to something else, because of the wheel 66 on which he placed himself as he was before.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 L’altra letizia, che m’era già nota 68 per cara cosa, mi si fece in vista 69 qual fin balasso in che lo sol percuota.
query.result: 67 The other joy, which was already known to me 68 as a dear thing, appeared to me 69 like a fine ruby on which the sun strikes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Per letiziar là sù fulgor s’acquista, 71 sì come riso qui; ma giù s’abbuia 72 l’ombra di fuor, come la mente è trista.
query.result: 70 To make one joyful up there, splendor is acquired, 71 just as laughter here; but down below, 72 the shadow outside darkens, just as the mind is sad.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 «Dio vede tutto, e tuo veder s’inluia», 74 diss’ io, «beato spirto, sì che nulla 75 voglia di sé a te puot’ esser fuia.
query.result: 73 "God sees everything, and your seeing is joined to His," 74 I said, "blessed spirit, so that no 75 desire of itself can be hidden from you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Dunque la voce tua, che ’l ciel trastulla 77 sempre col canto di quei fuochi pii 78 che di sei ali facen la coculla,
query.result: 76 Then why does your voice, which always delights heaven 77 with the song of those pious fires 78 that make a cowl with six wings,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 perché non satisface a’ miei disii? 80 Già non attendere’ io tua dimanda, 81 s’io m’intuassi, come tu t’inmii».
query.result: 79 not satisfy my desires? 80 I would not wait for your question, 81 if I could intuit myself, as you intuit me."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 «La maggior valle in che l’acqua si spanda», 83 incominciaro allor le sue parole, 84 «fuor di quel mar che la terra inghirlanda,
query.result: 82 "The greatest valley into which water spreads," 83 his words then began, 84 "out of that sea which garlands the earth,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 tra ’ discordanti liti contra ’l sole 86 tanto sen va, che fa meridïano 87 là dove l’orizzonte pria far suole.
query.result: 85 between the discordant shores against the sun 86 it goes so far that it makes a meridian 87 where the horizon usually rises first.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Di quella valle fu’ io litorano 89 tra Ebro e Macra, che per cammin corto 90 parte lo Genovese dal Toscano.
query.result: 88 I was a native of that valley 89 between the Ebro and the Magra, which by a short path 90 divides the Genoese from the Tuscan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Ad un occaso quasi e ad un orto 92 Buggea siede e la terra ond’ io fui, 93 che fé del sangue suo già caldo il porto.
query.result: 91 At almost the same sunset and sunrise 92 lie Buggea and the land from which I came, 93 which once made its harbor warm with its blood.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Folco mi disse quella gente a cui 95 fu noto il nome mio; e questo cielo 96 di me s’imprenta, com’ io fe’ di lui;

Please translate each line literally into English.
97 ché più non arse la figlia di Belo, 98 noiando e a Sicheo e a Creusa, 99 di me, infin che si convenne al pelo;

Please translate each line literally into English.
100 né quella Rodopëa che delusa 101 fu da Demofoonte, né Alcide 102 quando Iole nel core ebbe rinchiusa.
query.result: 100 nor that Rhodopean woman who was deceived 101 by Demophoon, nor Alcides 102 when he had Iole enclosed in his heart.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Non però qui si pente, ma si ride, 104 non de la colpa, ch’a mente non torna, 105 ma del valor ch’ordinò e provide.
query.result: 103 However, here one does not repent, but laughs, 104 not of the sin, which does not return to mind, 105 but of the power that ordained and provided.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Qui si rimira ne l’arte ch’addorna 107 cotanto affetto, e discernesi ’l bene 108 per che ’l mondo di sù quel di giù torna.
query.result: 106 Here one gazes again at the art that adorns 107 such affection, and the good is discerned 108 for which the world above returns the world below.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 Ma perché tutte le tue voglie piene 110 ten porti che son nate in questa spera, 111 proceder ancor oltre mi convene.
query.result: 109 But so that you may carry out all your desires fulfilled 110 that were born in this sphere, 111 it is fitting for me to proceed even further.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Tu vuo’ saper chi è in questa lumera 113 che qui appresso me così scintilla 114 come raggio di sole in acqua mera.
query.result: 112 You want to know who is in this light 113 that sparkles here beside me 114 like a ray of sun in pure water.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Or sappi che là entro si tranquilla 116 Raab; e a nostr’ ordine congiunta, 117 di lei nel sommo grado si sigilla.

Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Da questo cielo, in cui l’ombra s’appunta 119 che ’l vostro mondo face, pria ch’altr’ alma 120 del trïunfo di Cristo fu assunta.
query.result: 118 From this heaven, where the shadow ends 119 that your world makes, before any other soul 120 was assumed into the triumph of Christ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Ben si convenne lei lasciar per palma 122 in alcun cielo de l’alta vittoria 123 che s’acquistò con l’una e l’altra palma,
query.result: 121 It was fitting that she be left as a palm 122 in some heaven of the high victory 123 that was acquired with one palm and the other,

query.prompt:

124 perch’ ella favorò la prima gloria 125 di Iosüè in su la Terra Santa, 126 che poco tocca al papa la memoria.
query.result: 124 because she favored the first glory 125 of Joshua in the Holy Land, 126 which the pope scarcely recalls.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 La tua città, che di colui è pianta 128 che pria volse le spalle al suo fattore 129 e di cui è la ’nvidia tanto pianta,
query.result: 127 Your city, which is planted by him 128 who first turned his back on his Maker 129 and of whom envy is so lamented,

query.prompt:

130 produce e spande il maladetto fiore 131 c’ha disvïate le pecore e li agni, 132 però che fatto ha lupo del pastore.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Per questo l’Evangelio e i dottor magni 134 son derelitti, e solo ai Decretali 135 si studia, sì che pare a’ lor vivagni.
query.result: 133 Because of this, the Gospel and the great doctors 134 are abandoned, and only the Decretals 135 are studied, so that it appears in their margins.
